Social media posts and photographs: The expert's verdict mentions that social media users in Missouri began posting descriptions and photographs of the billboard. These posts and images provided initial evidence of the claim's authenticity.
Verification by St: Louis television station: The existence of the billboard was verified by St. Louis television station KMOV, which published their own photograph of it. This external verification adds credibility to the claim.
Corroboration of location: The description of the billboard's location provided by Martha Baker's Facebook post was corroborated by KMOV's description, stating that the billboard was located "on Interstate 170 near St. Charles Rock Road." This consistency in location details further supports the authenticity of the claim.
Expressions of concern by Christians: The expert's verdict mentions that the images of the billboard prompted expressions of concern by some Christians. This reaction from a specific group of people adds to the authenticity of the claim, as it reflects genuine reactions and discussions surrounding the billboard.
